title: Floyd Mayweather beats McGregor in battle of the watches
title_page: Floyd Mayweather beats McGregor in battle of the watches | Daily Mail Online
text:
Conor McGregor has shown off his latest big purchase - a watch to sit next to the hand he says made his fortune.
The Irish MMA star posted a picture to Instagram of his new Patek Philippe time piece, which has a retail price of $62,300 - approximately £48,000.
McGregor showed off the Nautilus Mechanical Blue Dial watch in a photo he captioned 'This left hand made me millions'.
The Irish MMA star posted a picture of his new watch which has a retail price of £48,000
Mayweather appeared at a press conference wearing a watch worth an incredible £500,000
That may seem like a pretty penny to most people, but not to Floyd 'Money' Mayweather, who is known for his love of expensive jewelery.
Not to be outdone by his would-be rival, Mayweather appeared in London to promote Gervonta Davis' fight against Liam Walsh on Wednesday.
During the press conference he was seen wearing his green Richard Mille RM 59-01, worth an eye-watering $620,000 - or roughly £500,000.
The watch is actually nicknamed the 'Mark of the Beast' after it was created in honour of Jamaican sprinter and brand ambassador Yohan Blake, whose track nickname is 'The Beast'.
The Nautilus Mechanical Blue Dial from Patek Philippe, as favoured by McGregor
Having lost the battle of the watches, McGregor can console himself with the fact the he could make millions more by fighting Mayweather.
However he didn't seem to have UFC or Mayweather on his mind on Thursday night, instead enjoying a night-out with friends.
Mayweather's Richard Mille RM 011 is worth more than ten times McGregor's watch
The 28-year-old posted a picture of him enjoying a flamboyant cocktail at a bar, captioned 'Let's get this party started hahahaha.'
McGregor's recent months have been entirely dominated by talk of the possible superfight against Mayweather, who recently called the Irishman out for, as the American put it, 'blowing smoke up everybody's ass'.
The long mooted bout is yet to be agreed due to a long standing disagreement over the money, and Mayweather said: 'He doesn’t really want to fight. If he really wanted to fight, sign the contract. He keeps telling everyone I’m scared of you, I'm scared of you.
'I’m going to sign the contract and then I’m going to get it faxed over to Conor McGregor and see if he’s going to sign it.'
